image.altText: A still image from an SA Police bodycam video showing a man who was tasered.

props.synopsis: SA Police defends its rising use of tasers, after the ABC obtained video of officers tasering a man who was on crutches. One Adelaide criminal lawyer says others have been seriously injured after getting tasered.

title.children: A man on crutches was shot in the back by police with a taser, as SA Police defend rising use

image.altText: A vector illustration of blue, red and grey lines laid over spherical glowing 3D world map on plain black background.

props.synopsis: The internet powers almost every aspect of our modern life and is key for governments, intelligence agencies, and banks – and there's a worldwide struggle for control happening under the radar and under the waves.

title.children: Explore the most important infrastructure you've never heard of – the plumbing of the internet

image.altText: a cricket match where an ad for parimatch is visible as a virtual billboard

props.synopsis: The federal communications watchdog examines whether Foxtel breached gambling laws by broadcasting ads for two illegal offshore betting companies during a test cricket match between Australia and New Zealand.

title.children: Foxtel under fire for illegal betting companies displayed during test cricket match

image.altText: Rachel Angus smiles, looking fresh, in a selfie taken indoors.

props.synopsis: Menopause has become "over-medicalised" and treated like a "disease", Australian researchers are arguing, saying some women are getting unnecessary treatment. But it's a controversial opinion.

title.children: Is menopause being treated like a 'disease'? A prestigious journal says yes – but it's a controversial view

image.altText: A group of long-stemmed wine glasses containing red wine being clinked together in a "cheers" salute.

props.synopsis: With the equivalent of more than 860 Olympic swimming pools worth of wine in storage and growers being paid 1970s prices for grapes, the industry is in a crisis bordering on catastrophe.

title.children: Nothing to cheer, as two-billion-litre glut of red wine sparks calls for halt on new vine plantings

image.altText: A man wearing a face mask is looking at a Southern Cross Station train platform

props.synopsis: Melbourne's Southern Cross Station is a gateway for commuters and visitors to the city, but experts say secret data shows the air quality poses a health risk to workers and passengers.

title.children: Thousands of people pass through this station each day, but experts say it has some of the worst air in Melbourne

image.altText: Australia's Sam Kerr waves up at the crowd in the stands after a Matildas game.

props.synopsis: Chelsea, Sam Kerr's London-based glamour club, remains silent more than a day after it was revealed its superstar striker has been charged with the racially aggravated harassment of a police officer.

title.children: Silence from stakeholders after Sam Kerr's criminal charge exposed

image.altText: Protesters on top of a truck

props.synopsis: Two environmental activists are jailed for 21 days for causing major traffic disruptions, after using a truck to block the busy West Gate Bridge.

title.children: Extinction Rebellion members jailed for blocking Melbourne's West Gate Bridge in climate protest

image.altText: A stylised image of the ASX trading board

props.synopsis: Australia's largest companies are reporting better-than-expected profits, despite their customers struggling with the cost of living and higher interest rates.

title.children: No sign of 'outright price gouging' in Australian companies' mega profits

image.altText: A closeup of Greens party member Max Chandler-Mather at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The Greens want the federal government to enter the property development game as part of a new housing policy to be unveiled on Wednesday afternoon.

title.children: The Greens want the government to compete with private property developers

image.altText: Paramedic in green work clothes with grey hair stands next to ambulance

props.synopsis: Paul Vinar has refuted evidence that he claimed his patient was overreacting with the "man flu" and was "causing drama", a coronial inquest has heard.

title.children: 'I had no reason to be rude': Adelaide paramedic defends his treatment of patient in the days before his death

image.altText: A man with a yellow checkered shirt walks outside of court surrounded by female journalists holding microphones.

props.synopsis: Kym Parsons, 73, is accused of carrying out 10 bank robberies while he was armed with a rifle in small South Australian towns between 2004 and 2014.

title.children: DNA and bullets from alleged 'bicycle bandit' linked to two robberies, court hears

image.altText: A view from above of an industrial site next to a sea with vacant land in the background.

props.synopsis: SA Health says findings in the latest report on blood lead levels in children living in Port Pirie are "mixed".

title.children: Young children in this industrial town with high blood lead levels doubles, but better results for toddlers

image.altText: Escalators at Carindale shopping centre busy with Christmas shoppers

props.synopsis: Whatever today's economic data shows about how close Australia is to recession the truth is we are already experiencing the biggest dive in living standards in half a century — and have been for two years, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: We're in the biggest dive in living standards in half a century. The 'unofficial' recession has begun

image.altText: A composite of Jeremy Rockliff sitting in the house of assembly folding his arms and Rebecca White looking off.

props.synopsis: Tasmanians will go to the polls in March in the dark about who donated to the major political parties, with one independent MP saying voters will "have no idea who may have bought influence".

title.children: Tasmanians are still clueless about who has donated to the major parties, despite laws passing parliament

image.altText: Xi Jinping sits at a wooden bench with two teacups on saucers sitting in front of him

props.synopsis: China's government uses its most important political meeting of the year, the National People's Congress, to respond to increasing pressure over its dire economic situation, outlining a plan to grow GDP and boost spending on defence.

title.children: China's economy is teetering towards crisis. This is Xi's plan to pull it back from the brink

image.altText: A man with grey hair holding a large live lobster

props.synopsis: This fisherman's catch of large southern rock lobsters is just as popular as the small ones.

title.children: Large lobsters are considered inferior to their small counterparts in taste. But this variety may be different

image.altText: A Taurus missile flies during a drill off the coast of South Korea.

props.synopsis: An audio recording of German military officers discussing the hypothetical use of Taurus missiles in Ukraine is leaked to Russian state media, embarrassing Germany and leading to accusations it was preparing for war.

title.children: Russia is threatening Germany over a leaked call between military officials. What was said and how did it happen?

image.altText: A black and white image shows an explosion on what appears to be the surface of water, behind a crosshair.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian military intelligence agency says a special operations unit destroyed the large patrol ship Sergey Kotov, in what would be a significant loss and an embarrassing blow for Moscow.

title.children: Ukraine says it has sunk another Russian warship in the Black Sea using high-tech sea drones

image.altText: A composite of two images: A close up of a man in a suit and tie, and a close up of Taylor Swift smiling while performing

props.synopsis: Lee Hsien Loong denies it was unfriendly that Singapore paid to host Taylor Swift's only tour stop in South-East Asia.

title.children: Exclusive Taylor Swift deal was not 'unfriendly' towards neighbours, Singapore PM says

image.altText: A young man with redish hair and wearing a checked shirt looks out from a balcony.

props.synopsis: Travis Mathews' story has never been made public, until now. He's speaking out about his experience at Sydney's Cranbrook School as part of a Four Corners investigation.

title.children: Former Cranbrook student says he was repeatedly sexually abused at private boys' school

image.altText: Mother and daughter take a photo in a creek.

props.synopsis: Alicia May filmed the swim with her children at a popular creek, but it was only when she was watching the footage that she spotted a dark shape lurking beneath the surface. Wildlife officers later estimated it to be a 3m crocodile.

title.children: Mother swimming with children unknowingly films 'sizeable' crocodile at popular Townsville swimming spot

image.altText: Meektharra terrain

props.synopsis: Police say a father and son have died while prospecting on a remote station in WA's Murchison region.

title.children: Father and son found dead while prospecting in WA's hot and remote outback

image.altText: A screenshot of St Kilda's Jimmy Webster hitting North Melbourne's Jy Simpkin high in an AFL preseason game.

props.synopsis: The AFL tribunal says the need to avoid head-high impact in the game has never been more acute, as it hands down a "significant sanction" to Saints player Jimmy Webster for his hit on North's Jy Simpkin in a trial match.

title.children: St Kilda's Webster handed lengthy ban at AFL tribunal for 'entirely avoidable' hit on Simpkin

image.altText: A blurred image showing two children against a garage door, and a man next to then with arms crossed.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged after a "confronting" incident, with video showing two children aged six and seven restrained with cable ties at a Broome home and another fleeing before police arrived.

title.children: Man charged after allegedly restraining three children with cable ties at Broome home

image.altText: Jingili murder accused video still

props.synopsis: Dramatic vision of the moment police arrested murder accused Warren Dhamarrandji in Jingili in 2020 has been played at his NT Supreme Court trial, showing police running up to the man, pushing him off his bike and onto the ground.

title.children: Bodyworn video showing dramatic arrest of Warren Dhamarrandji aired at Darwin murder trial

image.altText: Michelle Heyman holding hands with another matildas player.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government says the Matildas will face off against China at Adelaide Oval in May, ahead of the 2024 Paris Olympics.

title.children: Matildas to play China at Adelaide Oval in friendly game ahead of Paris Olympics

image.altText: A mother holds her baby in a hospital ward.

props.synopsis: Parents are questioning the standard of care at for-profit childcare centres amid a worker shortage and wage negotiations.

title.children: 'She wasn't breathing well': Ada's childcare centre should have known of her allergy. They fed her dairy anyway

image.altText: Two storey house half-burnt by lithium battery fire

props.synopsis: Two people killed in a Lake Macquarie house fire last week appear to be the state's first casualties from a lithium-ion battery-related blaze, Fire and Rescue NSW (FRNSW) says.

title.children: Two killed in NSW house blaze believed to be state's first recorded lithium-ion battery-related deaths

image.altText: Man with glasses wearing a suit and tie

props.synopsis: The father of four children who died between the years of 1989 and 1999 in the Hunter region, died earlier this week.

title.children: Craig Folbigg, former husband of Kathleen Folbigg, dies after heart attack

image.altText: A sign at a beach says "R.I.P" and has the initials of four people.

props.synopsis: Ankur Chhabra lost four members of his family in one day when they drowned at a beach. He hopes signs can be made clearer so others know the dangers of swimming on unpatrolled beaches.

title.children: Family devastated by multiple drownings want clearer danger signage on beaches

image.altText: A wide shot of a rocket blasting off from a launch pad into a clear sky, with flames and clouds of smoke below it

props.synopsis: The Optimus satellite is packed with Australian-made tech, and aims to help keep other satellites in space.

title.children: Australian company's satellite-repairing satellite blasts into space on SpaceX rocket

image.altText: Drone footage showing a Chinese Coast Guard boat coming close to a Phillipine Coast Guard boat.

props.synopsis: Philippines accuses China's coast guard of carrying out "dangerous manoeuvres" that led to a collision between its coast guard ship and a Chinese vessel during a resupply mission for Philippine troops in the South China Sea.

title.children: Philippines accuses China of 'dangerous manoeuvres' after coast guard ships collide

image.altText: A close up of Brittany Higgins.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins and her partner David Sharaz attend a mediation session with Ms Higgins's former employer, Senator Linda Reynolds.

title.children: All parties tight-lipped after first day of mediation between Brittany Higgins, David Sharaz and Linda Reynolds

image.altText: A composite image of Sinead O'Connor performing and Donald Trump talking into a mic

props.synopsis: The US presidential hopeful has been playing the late musician's trademark hit Nothing Compares 2 U at political rallies and campaign events.

title.children: Sinéad O'Connor's estate reminds Donald Trump she thought he was the 'biblical devil' and demands he stop using her music
